divs: Sighting DetailsIt was already quite dark, about 8 pm in late September, I guess, and I was on 75S, just crossing the border between MI and OH, when I noticed two bright lights, high up in the sky, flying East. The sky was starless, the color of dark blue ink. The two lights were flying in-line, one behind the other, but not overly close. For a moment I thought that the lights came from an airliner, helicopter, though that did not make sense. They must have been very far away, that's all I could estimate. Suddenly, the front light exploded, the explosion so large that the local sky lit up. I was expecting falling debris, pieces of the structure on fire, but I saw nothing like that. The explosion lasted a second or two, and then there was only one light left in the sky, steadily following its previous path. I arrived home around midnight (4 hrs later) and tried to see if the incident was reported on the TV news. The next morning I called the local TV stations and newspapers. No one had heard of an airplane accident, airline or other.
trends: There have been 35 other sightings in Toledo
There were no other sightings in Toledo on or around September 23rd 1995
Summary: observed two lights crossing the sky W-E, one exploded, the other continued on
